tagline: A simple demo to toggle DELs via the Raspberry Pi GPIOs
body:
### Pi4j Demo
This is a simple demo I wrote to introduce [ENSTA-Bretagne](http://www.ensta-bretagne.fr/) robotics students to the [Raspberry Pi](http://www.raspberrypi.org/) $35 computer.

It's a simple [Pi4j](http://www.pi4j.com/) (@Pi4j) that sets all the GPIOs of the Raspberry Pi pin header as outputs. You can then toggle each GPIO on/off, and drive DELs for example, using a simple graphical user interface.

You can find a pre-built jar in the dist/ folder. You need to run it as root.

```
$ cd Pi4jDemo/dist/
$ sudo java -jar Pi4jDemo.jar
```
